title: Dissappointed read

HOW CLASSY!

title: To be honest I only made it through about 35 ...
text: To be honest I only made it through about 35 pages. There's only so much boo hoo, woe is me whining that one can take. Nothing's my fault, everyone's out to get me, life in prison is sooo demeaning. Give me a break. Hopefully this is the last we hear from him.

title: Definitely NOT as described, including the actual author
text: This book is advertised as having 76 pages, when it in fact has only 64 pages. Its author is NOT "J.L. Hudson, but is instead Florence Davies, former Art Editor of the Detroit News. J.L. Hudson SPONSORED the book but did NOT author it. The paintings are quite small, and all are in black and white. To say I am disappointed is an understatement.

title: OK for what it is, but there are better books

title: It was so wordy with so much unnecessary details that had nothing to do with anything

text:
This is a review of the PRINT BOOK.
I bought this book after ‚Äúlooking inside.‚Äù
‚ÄúLook inside‚Äù has pictures of tools, etc., this book does not! Even projects, don‚Äôt have pictures or even drawings!
Most reviews are from the Kindle edition.
I buy a lot of jewelry making books from Amazon, but this is the worst!
This is the first book, I‚Äôm returning.
You can find the info on the Internet and with pictures!

title: i did not find this useful. it seems like these companies and using you ...
text: i did not find this useful. it seems like these companies and using you to make money by charging people to enter contests that one person out of 1000's will win.

title: The worst of the worst
text: This is the worst book I have read or listened to in ages! And there‚Äôs been a lot a junk lately. Is so repetitive that when I would skip chapters the main characters was saying the same dialogue. Every chapter was the same chapter. First and last time reading anything by this author

title: Don't waste your time on this.
text: This is a horrible 22 page (brochure) book stapled together on rug hooking. He doesnt really tell you how to rug hook. But he goes into great boring detail about what you use, in the event you can figure out how to do it. I think Kevin's wife must hook rugs and he has been watching her do it for so long he figured he could write a book about it.

title: I was duped
text: ‚ÄúBook Tok‚Äù convinced me to get this novel, I got the audible version. It‚Äôs just not good. Stopped listening halfway through and forgot about it until Amazon asked me to review my purchases‚Ä¶if that tells you how much I cared about the characters.

title: A Hatchet Job on Highsmith
text: I sensed the biographer wanted to do something different with this work, something short and snappy, unlike the usual ponderous tomes. But it is also an unremittingly negative portrayal of Highsmith.

title: Outdated book. Check year published before you buy
text: I bought as we are moving to Seattle. It‚Äôs so outdated it doesn‚Äôt even have the neighborhood we are moving too. Check publishing date before you buy used books.

title: Audible review only: narrator hard to understand
text: This is not a review of the book, but of the Audible audiobook.  The narrator speaks as if with a mouthful of marbles.  Words run together and are poorly enunciated.  Getting a refund.

title: Not as described
text: I was so excited to get the book. When I opened it, the inside of the book was good but the cover was missing and there was water damage on the edges of the book.  The book was going to part of my new collection.  Had to return for a refund.

title: Tricky Advertisement Magazine
text: Don't do it, unless you like advertisements. There isn't much unique inspirational material and most the pages are advertisements, better off googling pictures of homes for inspiration.

title: Not Holidays with Hades
text: The sample is Mystical Midlife in Maine but the download is Midlife Witchery Yule Tidings. Don't know how this got mixed up on Amazon downloads but it did.  Please get this fixed.

title: NOT for me
text: My book club decided to read this, and I could not, can not, will not read it, even with green eggs and ham.  My eyes glaze over  and my blood pressure goes up after only a few sentences. I have a PhD.D. and am used to reading some difficult material but I must be missing a gene for decoding  this convoluted and arcane writing. A tortured and pompous attempt that's potentially of interest to a small clique of philosophers.

title: Was hoping for photos and more detailed trail maps. ...
text: Was hoping for photos and more detailed trail maps.  This doesn't have any info I haven't found online, and didn't provide suggestions for how to connect several hikes to create a full day of hiking.  I tried to return it and was going to be charged $5 to return it.

title: This book is terrible!!!
text: I have read many books in this genre and have never read one as boring and slow as this. The book never gets to the point (which is?). There is no story to the book, just rambling continuation of the same thing. Also there is hardly a climax and end to the story. If the movie is anything like this, it must be a bomb too!!

title: The Beatles content seems to be about 2%.  Just weird pictures that have nothing to do with Beatles lyrics.
text: The pictures don't seem to have much to do with the Beatles or their songs, or lyrics, at all.  This book is a joke.  I don't recommend it at all.  There are a few interesting pictures in it, but it's a large book and a waste of time and money.

title: It was not the dictionary as appeared for selling
text: This is not the same item that appeared at Amazon. The book did not bring the original cover and is an old version from 1979. I did not realize the year of the dictionary. I am not happy with the dictionary that I received. It was my responsibility for haven't checking the description of it.

title: For beginner Antique Jewellery Collectors Only!
text:
Nothing new for a collector of Antique Jewellery! Pretty much all the pieces on this book have been in other Jewelry books!!! And the funny/annoying thing no prices of the auction prices are listed either.

Sad to say I was really disappointed with it. Buy a used copy if you really want it!

title: Fake
text: How is possible that a person can imitate Anthony William on  Brain Saverrrrr. You, to the writer, I am talking!!!!  How you dare to try to be like Anthony! I hope everyone can appreciate your disrespectful behavior.

title: disappointed
text: I'm not sure if it is a marketing issue or if I just have high expectations but to me this book seemed written for young adults or middle grade readers. It was too simplistic for me as I was expecting more. It isn't because the protagonist was an 11 year old boy. I've read plenty of great fiction with young characters. I just think Mark's young angst and otherworldly adventures would be better aimed towards a younger reading group.

title: The subject sounded wonderful and it might have been from a better writer
text: This book was awful! I have never thought that of a book, let alone one on this subject matter since I travel to France frequently. Poorly written....I could not even pass on to my students or friends. This must of been published by the author! Context did not match....People don't "dial" from the their mobile phones! The subject sounded wonderful and it might have been from a better writer. Save your money! I wish I had!!!!!!!

title: Not good
text:
The original series are some of my favorite books. Unfortunately after 2nd series, this story has gone rancid. Page after page, chapter after chapter of whining and self doubt. Every event causes the same string of boo hoo.
Read the first 6, maybe the next one or two if desperate, forget the rest.

title: not good
text: I didn't finish this book it was really boaring. It is mostly a list of the suplies and skills the charecters have. Everyone is one is wooden and dull. I could go on but other reviws say basicaly the same things so I am writeing the review to contribute to the over all star rateing.

title: Cute fairy tale-like story
text:
I've read other stories by this author and I do like her writing style. I grabbed this to see if I wanted to read the Darkwood Trilogy. And yes. Yes, I do.

It reads like a fairy tale that shows the journey of how they came to trust each other and maybe fall in love.

title: Family project
text:
This book is more for a parent and a child. Something cute to work on at the kitchen table.
What you see on the front cover, is all they show you. The book looks like it should be so much more. Plus I was fooled by the price of this book. Way over priced.
I wasn't happy with his purchase. Sorry

title: Boring. We All Hated It
text: Both I and my students hated this book. We used it last fall and gave up on it in November. So boring. Why is it so tough to get good reading and writing textbooks? I liked the idea of bringing the reader's own experience to bear on the text, but in reality, it offered very little of that, and what it did offer was lecture-ie, deadly dull.

title: It's not what you think
text: Make sure you understand the work of Brian Kilmeade. Got this as a gift for my husband because he has always loved Abraham  Lincoln and Frederick Douglass. Wow, was I duped! Didn't realize his support of Fox News and what they stand for.

title: Book description is written better than book.
text: Absolute disappointment & waste of time & money.  The romance & time travel elements are suitable for a fourth grade level.  The incorrect usage of words -since/sense, portals, portables, port hole & run on sentences are jarring to the flow of the simplistic storyline & characters.  Author should refund readers upon request. It's that bad.

title: a mean and nasty story
text: I agree that the story is extremely negative and I also found the "shut up" and"dumbo" offensive, not to mention that many of the creatures were rude and ungrateful

title: I have two copies... what a waste of money
text: I have two copies of this... one for each house.  Unfortunately, time and time again I have had to turn to older dictionaries for common words.  This is the worst dictionary I have.  I have Langenscheidt dictionaries for other languages as well, but I don't use them as much.  I will never purchase any dictionary from this publisher again.

title: Incredibly racist
text:
I tried writing a detailed review, but it was not published, so here's a simple review.

This is a pro-white book of white supremacy disguised as history.

That's all, folks.

title: POOR QUALITY‚ÄîMisleading condition label
text: Book was not in VERY GOOD condition. Both front and back covers were bent upon arrival, and the spine had several tears (way beyond age/normal wear.) SUPER disappointed in the misleading condition label. Better to rate lower than higher so your customers can be pleasantly surprised instead of unpleasantly disappointed.

title: Not a beginners book
text: Way too complicated for me. There is no real step by step. I think this is geared more for someone who already knows how to weave but wants a small one that can travel with them. Sadly my brain just can't process her way of teaching.

title: Nope
text: How very sad. So many errors. Why read a book if you can't trust the source.  Might as well make up my own story about her..... :(.  This should actually be pulled back off the shelves. I would not be happy if I were Stevie......

title: What a stinker
text: It is now only skimpy on research but badly written. Koster didn't bother spending much time in the archives or stacks and it shows. It is a book for conspiracy hacks of the lowest order.

title: $10.75  for this POS? No, thanks.
text: The moon is like a huge star? We can have cookies after breakfast? This book is awful. We couldn't  even finish reading it. Not worth the time or the money.

title: Very disappointing
text: This is the worst book of the series. I'm not sure why Box had to include political themes. The book didn't require it. Also, the writing itself was not up to par. The book dragged and some of the characters were so lame. I wondered if Box wrote it. Also, the book ends with a cliff hanger. I feel I wasted 15 dollars.

title: Ouch
text: The book should have been entitled Whine. While we feel sympathy for those struggling this gal complains about everything and everybody. Sleeps with a basic stranger, gets pregnant, goes on the dole and it's still everyone else's fault. Much better memoirs out there of those who have struggled but succeeded. Hope it ends well for her and her child.

title: Great Title, But...
text: Probably the worst book I've read...ever. Overall, not very good writing, promotes archaic stereotypes, and, for such a short book, is very redundant. I had read the Amazon reviews [which there were very few] and feel rather deceived. I think they must be friends or relatives. I will be recycling the book, not donating or giving it away.

title: Bad Binding,  No Hole
text: I love the Farmers Almanac however this version is bound differently. It is glued on the spine instead of stapled so it is very difficult to hold open and handle. They also didn't punch a hole in this version like they do with the real one. Very disappointed.

title: Another Kindle robbery.
text: Why oh why do four paperback books cost $20 when the Kindle version is $30? There are so many Kindle books with similar bass-ackwards pricing. When will the publishers get the hint? I (grudgingly) buy Kindle books that are priced the same as the paperbacks, but I will NOT pay more!

title: Tells you ultimately nothing specific about your Morkie
text: The book doesn't tell you anything about Morkies. It's a series of books for all different breeds and most of the information in one is just copied into the others.  Wasn't helpful at all for finding specifics about my little 10 lb Morkie.  Better information was available on the internet and from others who know about dogs in general.

title: Wow. What a let down.
text: For me this story was a serious let down. The premise sounded good and it had a lot of promise starting out. Unfortunately, the ending was quite disappointing. It felt to me like a cop out and I found the main characters unlikable as well. This ranks high in my list of bad stories read. More than my money, I wish I could get a refund for my time spent reading this.

title: Not worth remembering
text: The book is very slow and deliberate in approach, and it‚Äôs not surprising that the end leads to nothing.  The book is about things coming to an end and memories of those things coming to an end as well. That‚Äôs it!  There is nothing else taking place here, despite what others may say in their reviews.

title: Waste of money
text: A friend for me this for Christmas. The spine is so poorly put together I can't read it. She asked for a refund but has yet to hear anything. I  will gladly send it back

title: Bought it as a joke gift for xmas. Now ...
text: Bought it as a joke gift for xmas.  Now my kindle keep suggesting similar books. Every time I pull out the kindle it has an ad with a similar cover to this book.

title: Terrible book
text: The only thing that is worthwhile with this book is the pretty cover.  I ordered two books; one for myself and one for a friend.  Both books got tossed into the Goodwill bag.  Huge disappointment.

title: Where is the review of the Titanic
text: I clicked on "On Board the Titanic" only to find reviews of some Murder She Wrote book that takes place in Savannah.  So, it appears that there is no review of this item.  Very disappointing.

title: My book that I received in damage. Can you replace please?
text: I would like this book replaced with one of proper material that is not broken. I did not pay for a damaged book. I paid for a book in great shape. One that is treated with respect. Thank you.

title: Horrible Book
text:
This book is nothing more than a bunch of big words with long winded sentences, clearly it makes the author feel important. This book teaches the reader nothing. It confuses more than educates the reader. Not one concept is clearly laid out and easy to follow and the pictures are terrible.
There are several other books on this subject that are far more superior than this one. Please look in to other books before purchasing this one.

title: The Price Should be $4.95
text: The paper is fine, although not nearly as bright & colorful as the pictures.  The biggest problem with this product is that the price is printed right on the back -- $4.95.  This seller is jacking up the price.  I might be persuaded to buy the giftwrap again, but I won't fall for this cheesy trick again.

title: Don't be fooled by the cute cover
text: From magic toadstools with psychedelic powers, to teaching stealing is ok and destroy the evidence to an almost predator like grooming way of writing that screams of princesses being kidnapped are nothing to be alarmed by. This book is rather alarming to be aimed at kids.

title: Liberal rewrite of US history.
text:
The Bill of Rights section alone should get this book removed. Just reading that section alone and the author's "interpretation" of that document colored the rest of my opinion.

Filled with liberal revisionist history.

I would seek out books with actual factual information and less "interpretation" of facts.

title: Not helpful
text:
I wanted to teach my child the periodic table but instead of having the abbreviated element for example
(Au for gold) it has cartoons I do not want my child to memorize cartoons

title: Not acceptable.
text:
I didn't like the meanness and name calling in part of the story.
My grandson knows not to bully and make people feel bad. At one point in the book, the giraffe says, 'I am useless' after being called a fool, clumsy and weird.
My grandson doesn't need a book that makes bullying appear acceptable.

title: YOUNG LIVING ADVERTISEMENT ALERT!!!!
text: First of all....THIS IS A YOUNG LIVING ADVERTISEMENT. SO, IF YOU DONT USE YOUNG LIVING, DONT GET THIS BOOK. I'm very upset that I unsuspectedly purchased a Young Living advertisement book. Secondly, this book is written for a child. Do not buy this book, you'll be upset you did.

title: They ruined it!
text: In what's apparently an effort to save some plastic, this calendar, which I have long used changed this year and now has a bigger format and cardboard, not plastic backing & stand. The result is it no longer fits in the spot where it has on my desk for years, and it does not atand up as well. I likely will shop for something different next year as they took a good thing and screwed it up!

title: Do not waste your time here...
text:
I was only on page 75 and I wanted to throw the book away, so now reading other reviews.
I cannot seem to stop bad books or movies, mon dieu!

Writing: horrible and immature.
No reality as I was hoping for about the famed Apartment.
Too many teenage phrases stuck in. Just because she "dresses French" does not make the lead character mature. In fact she is very childish.
Whole book poorly written.

title: Unfortunately, requires a special ($65) pliers, and special sized rings
text:
The author is a very good designer. I hate to give this book one star.

The problem is, he doesn't use readily available jump rings or mandrel pliers.

There seems to be only one source for the jump rings and pliers.

There is no excuse for this.

This is not the way to write a chain maille book!

I do not recommend!

title: I see why these are bedtime stories.
text: Definitely the cure for insomnia because I was ready to fall asleep in the middle of the day due to how boring this was.  Maybe I just was expecting too much, or maybe my taste in comedy is different from other people's.  If you enjoyed this then bully for you, but it was not my cup of tea.

title: Terrible additions to codeword puzzles premise
text: Adding a personality and and terrible extra 'code' of symbols demeans the codeword premise. It might suit a child but seems designed not to work your brain. Overpriced and pointless addition to the codeword puzzle genre.

title: Basic Boring Limites Recipes. Save your $$
text: The paperback book is so small. Very few recipes. Basic information you can pull off the web. I do not recommend this book to anyone. Over priced. It reads as if a preschooler wrote it. Absolute Garbage.

title: did not enjoy
text: I found this book difficult to get into. It's one of those writing styles where passages start in the middle of something or apropos of nothing and expect you to read on to figure out what's what. I also found the writing choppy, awkward and difficult to read. Actions and events are stretched out as if paid by the word. Wordy. It was a struggle to read and I just didn't enjoy it.

title: YAWN ...
text:
Yet another flimsy mish mash of a Jacobite-exile time-traversing tale. Ms Kearsley seems to only have one story, set in one pair of time frames, that she reheats for each book. It gets more threadbare and more boring each time it's recycled.
If you really want to give this tired thing a try, I suggest you save your money and just borrow it from your local library.

title: Wrong item, did not match description.
text: This product came as a book, not the audio CD as described. It was a disappointment as I ordered it and it was to be delivered to my blind Mother several States away.

title: terrible
text: ugh. i rarely write book reviews because they are so subjective. but this book is terrible. the characters are flat and unbelievable. the plot is predictable and also completely contrived and impossibly unrealistic. save yourself the pain and find another book.

title: Text is way too small and close together
text: The book itself is great but this particular version of the text is really difficult to read. The letters are really small and there isn't any space between the lines. I had to throw this book away and use a version I downloaded online.

title: Cute but awful paper quality
text: Adorable and cute illustrations.  Quite the variation in theme, as well as, detail level from beginner to mid-advanced.  However, markers 100% bleed through.  Gel pens seemed to be ok if using a light hand.  Such a shame the paper quality is so poor.

title: Negligible Actual Poetry
text: Buyer beware: across some 200 pages of "text" of Archilochus, you buy nothing but the smallest fragments of the actual poet's work. The rest is endless snippets of commentary from ancient thought leaders, anecdotal and repetitive. It's a similar story with Seomides and Hipponax. I felt ripped off.

title: Not much different from all the other compilations
text: Someone once said of the kama sutra - position 59 is like 58 but with your fingers crossed.  The same applies to this as so many of these Bhajan based books - thousands of kriyas but they are very similar to each other and no one ever says why THIS one is better than THAT one for the purpose.  If you already have a couple of such compilations you can do without this one

title: Don't get involved in this book - once you get invested in time you want to finish but it never gets much better
text: This was a good story idea but the author told the story more than showed so I never got to a point where I cared about any of the characters. Hence, I didn't give a rats ass how the story ended - I just wanted it over. To the author - you have a good start and my hats off to you for finishing a novel. I know it's hard work. Just next time, spend less time telling the story and more time letting the characters drive the story (through dialogue, action, etc.).

title: I was duped! :(
text:
The book is extremely small, cheap, with print impossible to read without a magnifying glass. I was duped!
I have purchased MANY Penguin books, cloth-covered, "normal-sized", and absolutely lovely.

title: No redeeming qualities at all...
text: This novel has no original content at all. It's sort of a cross between a very bad Tv show called Roswell and XMen. The worst thing about it is it's only book one which means more will follow. What a waste of paper.

title: This will screw up your kindel
text: I had all sorts of softwear problems with my kindle the day I downloaded this. When I deleted it because I couldn't read it any way My kindle started working normally. If You want this get it on CD.

title: Online portion of this is unusable
text:
After several emails and calls to activate the online portion of this product, I am giving up. This is not user friendly at all.

I suggest looking elsewhere for online training, or at least valuing this purchase as only having the hardcopy paper to work with.

title: White trash!
text: It is unfortunate that this book attempts to be about the great Escoffier.  I found it degrading and poorly written.  The story line did not hold together.  I would hate to have people remember Escoffier based upon reading this book.

title: The description made it seem like an actual book (same with one of my other ...
text: The access code was already used and put me behind in class and lost out on points. Shipping is the only thing warranting a star since it was average. The description made it seem like an actual book (same with one of my other textbooks that I ordered). This is the first, and hopefully last, time that this happens with Amazon.

title: This is supposed to be the best mystery ever?
text: So disappointed. I expected so much more than this dry, pedantic, with no suspense and the characters are like cardboard. From the first page you know who's going to kill whom and no one person in the book is likeable. This charmless piece of work is not worth the paper it's printed on or the time to read it. In my view, I would recommend mysteries by Josephine Tey, Georgette Heyer and even Agatha Christie.

title: Forget about this book - nasty story.
text: Forget this book.  I was so disappointed when I read this story.  The princess doesn't kiss the frog to turn him into a prince; she throws the frog against the wall!  What the heck is that!  Not a story I want for my granddaughter

title: I wouldn't buy this if it were free.
text: I will neither buy nor read this book after reading  the report by Abigail Rockwell, norman Rockwell's granddaughter.  She should know about the truth held between the covers of this book.  Since she has said the truth does not live there.  I don't understand why it has been so highly praised by the media other than for money and the fact that the media, today, has an aversion to truth.

title: Great except for one thing
text: It would be an amazing book for keeping up with debts except for one thing.  It has a typo or English error or whatever you want to call it on the first column of EVERY PAGE FOR TEN YEARS.  I am super OCD but am going to try to just ignore it FOR TEN YEARS.  See pic

title: A big yawn
text:
This is little more than a coffee table picture book of homes of wealthy people who appear to have allowed (their?) pets inside long enough to be photographed.

Nice homes, nice photography, and there is at least one animal in each picture.

title: not as advertised
text:
I ordered a paperback book because I had the kindle edition which has beautiful colored photos as advertised "A collection of 112 colour photographs."
I got the paperback yesterday and none of the photos are in color.

title: Disappointing!
text: Wow.  This was listed as a used book but it should have said this was a crumpled very dirty pages ripped out book. Looks like it was run over by a car or several trucks!  And I am not a picky buyer.

title: Couldn't Finish
text: Couldn't get into this. It felt like the author had just learned new curse words in German and was like a little kid in wanting to use them *constantly*. Plus, for a story that takes place during World War II in Germany, the material is surprisingly light-hearted. Granted, I stopped reading about halfway through, so maybe the intensity picked up a bit, but I didn't care to stick around long enough to find out.

title: Good content but binding fell apart after two days
text: As others have noted, the binding is poor quality. I purchased it thinking maybe I would not have this problem, but the book is falling apart after two days (and I was extra careful as I turned each page). I will probably return it and get an e-book version. I love the well organized and attractively designed content, just perfect for a novice gardener, especially the monthly suggested task lists.

title: I mailed back the next day
text: I was extremely disappointed in this book, many non-armor shots, many armor types repeated, the early Mark IVB shots aren't in North Africa, out of focus photos, etc.  There are much better books on the market on aromor in the western desert - pass this one up.

title: Needs a Good Editor Among Other Things
text: Full of typos throughout, but that could be forgiven to a large extent if the book itself was any good. It isn't. Trite, predictable plot with banal dialogue. Don't think I'll be wasting any money on the second book in this dreary series.

title: Blah blah blah
text: A book written for people who barely read. It‚Äôs full of cliche thoughts and invalid syllogisms akin to a racist claiming not to be one because he once knew someone who was black.

title: My Name Is Nathan Lucius by Mark Winkler, Hardcover ‚Äì February 20, 2018
text: Grim. Whatever made me order this unpleasant story I regretted it fully by the last page. There is nothing palatable or compelling or intriguing or insightful. Published in 2015 as WASTED in South Africa. Nathan is a freak, someone to be avoided in life, and he is the narrator. I felt unclean.

title: Not what I wanted
text: I intended to use it to teach different basic styles to some young teens. This was just a mishmash of wannabe designers that mix everything up. If you mix EVERYTHING, you get nothing.

title: Craft book, not woodworking
text: If you want a craft book, then this is it. If you want a woodworking book to spend time in the shop with your children look for something else. There‚Äôs 3-4 projects with wood, the rest are popsicle sticks, clothes pins, and string, nothing wrong with that, just not woodworking. There‚Äôs no color pages in the book, so children don‚Äôt even want to look at it. It‚Äôs the same quality that you can get from your home printer. Really sad that there was so much potential here and it missed the mark.

title: Where is the credibility stop advertising
text: This more so than a review is a complain about how ‚Äúreaders‚Äù have been doing reviews about books without actually doing a review but more so doing an advertising about the authors work and how to buy a book set and so forth what is that about? Most of the reviews of this book consist of that on how this book is so good and to go ahead and just buy thr book set of 3 to save money...umm no thanks. This says A LOT about the ethics of the publishing company and whoever is all for doing these reviews to do the author some favor. It loses credibility.

title: This book is a disjointed mess of word salad. ...
text:
This book is a disjointed mess of word salad.

1. It is poorly organized and laid out - for example, chapter 7 has an introduction, conclusion, and ONE body section.
2. It is riddled with spelling errors and there is at least one time where the NAME OF THE FIRM being discussed changes in the middle of the section.
3. It includes nonsense sentences such as, "Diversity is to be cherished, for it enriches life and advances the actualization of human potential."

title: an anti death penalty treatise masquerading as a novel
text: If this was the first Grisham novel I read it would be the last. The story itself was kind of interesting but ended up as nothing more than a treatise against capital punishment. The caricatures of Texas, Texans, conservatives, Baptists, small towns, conservative talk show hosts and anyone for the death penalty were beneath this writer. I've given Grisham 5 stars for other books but this one was a waste of time and money. So boring and overwritten in some spots that you could just skim through. Disappointing.

title: Could Not Get Into This
text:
Life is too short to force yourself to keep reading a bad book. There's so many good books waiting to be read. People have told me "You didn't finish it you shouldn't review it." I say they're wrong. I think reviewing a book that you couldn't finish is a necessity. I always check the bad reviews for any product first.
Sanctuary of the Damned. I don't know who's damned, I assume it's at least a few of the characters we meet at the beginning. I have no idea what the hook is. I made it to 15% reported several errors and just could not get into it. I felt no empathy for any of the characters. The were like mannequins with interchangeable parts. It didn't do anything for me.
I tried. I gave up. The end.

title: Doctor Benjamin Franklin's Dream America
text:
I‚Äôve enjoyed alternate history books in the past, especially when they‚Äôre mashed up with fantasy or science fiction. I usually find it interesting to see the different spins authors put on such eras. So, I was intrigued by the idea of the Founding Fathers having the Internet and social media.

Only to actually start the book and wonder what the heck I‚Äôd gotten myself into. Each chapter is about the death of one of the men who signed the Declaration of Independence. I guess they‚Äôre dying because of their connection to the Cloud, which is somehow replicating and creating worms and a plague? And then it gets crazier.

To me, this is the sort of book where the author takes a bunch of ideas and concepts he wants to explore, tosses them in a hat, and pulls stuff out at random to include in a chapter. I couldn‚Äôt suspend my disbelief enough to rationalize the Internet, smartphones, and computers existing but medicine still being extremely primitive, horses the main mode of transportation, etc.

title: Not my cup of tea
text: Bought this book thinking it was a  who done it or a race against time. It was not. It was a let's make everyone feel good about themselves and all be happy book. Not that their is anything wrong with that. Just not my cup of tea. That said, the story is slow, everything is drawn out including how many times a day they have tea yet the characters are likeable except of course the one that your suppose to hate. I'm sure many people love this author but for me she goes on my never buy again list

title: Errors and difficult to use
text:
The book is horribly put together. The binding is so tight you have to pry the book apart to see what the rest of the paragraph says. So to sit back and read this book you have to have some strong forearm strength. And if you try to pry open the book too much the pages will fall out. Brand new book and chapter 3 has already fallen out within 3 months of casual use.
I agree with the other 1 star review that my professor just uses it for equations and there are only a few you need. My professor then just explains it not from the book at all.
The author can be humorous but definitely errors and typos.
I would recommend the publisher to use thinner paper so that you don't have to pry the book apart just to finish the paragraph.

title: The Bear and the Nightingale (Winternight #1)
text:
I should have really liked THE BEAR AND THE NIGHTINGALE. Russian-inspired fantasy? Rebellious main character? Old gods? Check, check, and check.

Yet I could barely keep my eyes open while I read. The book plodded along at a glacial pace. The first quarter of the book is scene setting/backstory. There are maybe five sections from Vasya‚Äôs POV. Instead nearly everyone gets a chance, from the new stepmother to her brothers and even a monk. I think the author was trying to show the world from all angles, but it fell very flat for me.

I was not enthralled by this book, or even interested. I just wanted something to happen instead of turning page after page and waiting for plot to show up.

title: Very Disappointed!!
text:
This book It happened in Brooklyn should add the title "If you where Jewish" I was born and raised in Canarsie . Went to Tilden High , And
feel that the description of Brooklyn the 30s thru the 50s is not properly described .unless of course you where Jewish .
I am of Welsh decent so cant really say i am a little one sided 'Italian Versus Jew's,Jews versus Irish etc. 85% of the character and flavor of places and times describing Brooklyn have been been ignored . This books title should be "It happened to the Jewish People in Brooklyn .........Very Disappointed !!!!

title: Fake, Wannabe-Ghetto-Cool Bible
text:
Why do publishers feel like they need to FOOL kids and teenagers into thinking the Bible is some Rolling Stone-like magazine with gangster-wannabe catch phrases inserted on every page? When you get to the content, Matthew 1:1 is still Matthew 1:1, regardless of the deceptive phrases on the cover.

If the choice for kids is coming down to buying NO Bible or buying one that "looks" cool on the outside, then they are not going to be reading this Bible for long. In the meanwhile, we're only advancing the idea that you SHOULD judge a book by its cover.

An edition for teens is one thing, an edition that is flat out deceiving? Terrible, terrible idea. What's next? The swimsuit edition?

title: This one just proves that we'll read anything....if....
text: ... James Patterson's name is on it.  Sweet and touching in the beginning, this one takes a "flyer" that is 'way outside the realm of even fanciful fantasy.  What a crashing disappointment!  What's worse, it makes me think that James and his friend, Gabrielle, are really "funning" with us to find out just how much drivel we will lap up before yelling, "Enough"!  By gosh, we're tried and true fans out here, and we've loyally bought book after book, through good and bad;  waited out your slumps and celebrated your returns to the groove we love so well.  And, we were ready for something different - we think it's okay when you deviate from your norm.  We liked Suzanne's Diary and Sam's Letters - but what on earth were you thinking with this one?  This one is a waste of time and money, unfortunately.  I wish I'd saved my money and pre-ordered your next book.  Yeah, once a fan, always a fan, no matter what.

title: Why make a book that has to be thrown out??
text: When the light stopped working because I guess the battery died....there is no way to change it!!!  You have to literally tear the thing apart.  Now that I have reached the battery which is hidden under layers of cardboard, with wires taped all over it, the while back and sides are ripped up.  I only kept at it because I knew I'd have to throw it out!  you nearly have to resort to using C4 explosive.  That makes absolutely zero sense and it's a shame because it's a cute book.

title: Bitchy Holly üëé
text: I feel I liked Holly more before I read her book. Somewhere in between reading between the lines - the gossip and jealousy Holly turned into a real sourpuss. The book really doesn‚Äôt go into many inside details of Heff and the playboy mansion besides the gossip and cattiness of the girls- that part which I could fully understand, though Holly seems to paint herself as an angel and yet it is so obvious from the episodes and reading this book how fake she really is . Isabella St. James said Holly was like the single white female version of the mansion and tried to manipulate Heff - I believe that to be true. Another gold digger - crash and burn! Not a book I‚Äôd recommend - just fluff! üëé

title: Flimsy
text: This "book" reads like something that belongs on the Sunday comics page directly between Prince Valiant and Zits.  The author exhibits a sesnibility for ancient history about as deep and lasting as newsprint.  The iPod-cellphone-gizmo crew will swallow it down with everything else that's a half-nanometer thick and pass on to the next thing.  ANYONE with a genuine affection and empathy for alchemy, for Flamel, for Dee and for the ancient deities will be wincing every alternate paragraph.  DO NOT give it to a teenager you care about: they are better off with candid misinterpretations of ancient wisdom rather than this masquerade.  Ugh!

title: nothing new here
text: I bought this book hoping for some innovative ideas on keeping myself organized.  Most of this book is the author telling stories about how much someone  using this "system" has improved their life.  Most of the actual useful content is about 2 pages and nothing particularly groundbreaking.  No kidding, one of the tips was to not completely write out a thought you might have, but to summarize it in as few words as possible and use an appropriate bullet to keep track of it.  Don't waste your time or money with this book.

title: Barely worth one star.
text: I read so many good reviews here, so I thought it would be great.  However, this book is very misleading.  If you are of the LDS Faith (a Mormon), this might be helpful, as the first half of the book preaches straight religion... talks about a Family Evening night, uses a bunch of scriptures, etc.  I didn't buy this book to get a religious lesson, I bought it for emergency preparedness.  It really turned me off, which made it hard to choke down the rest of the book... even if the recipes might be good.  I will definitely be returning this book to Amazon and looking for something with a broader target audience.  What a disappointment!

title: The Fandom
text:
I liked the idea of THE FANDOM. Characters getting sucked into the world of their favorite fandom? Sign me up. But within pages, the characters and writing had me cringing and wondering why I‚Äôd fallen into another trap book with a cool idea and horrible execution.

First, The Gallows Dance is ‚Ä¶ I found it to be really silly. Naturally, Violet has a Very Big Crush on the main guy character, so much that she can‚Äôt bear his picture to have a thumbtack hole in it. Then after her presentation, Violet proceeds to have horribly mean and catty thoughts about her best friend. Violet‚Äôs narration was painful to read from the start and didn‚Äôt get any better.

THE FANDOM combines a bunch of YA tropes, mediocre writing, and underdeveloped characters.

title: Furyborn (Empirium #1)
text:
FURYBORN is a door stopper kickoff to a new YA fantasy trilogy. Books structured with one character in the past and one in the present normally don‚Äôt appeal to me, but here I liked the initial descriptions for both Rielle and Eliana. I‚Äôm on a big royalty kick lately, so I was especially excited for Rielle‚Äôs chapters.

The prologue/beginning was the best part of FURYBORN for me, but in a way, also the worst part. The prologue captured my interest. I instantly wanted to know more about Rielle, her powers, her world, the angels, etc. But the prologue spoils Rielle‚Äôs fate. I already knew she would pass the trials, so I didn‚Äôt care too much about how she passed them or her feelings for Audric.

I was so bored reading FURYBORN. If I‚Äôm going to slog my way through a 500 page book, I do not want to be bored! The book was rushrushrush action yet it didn‚Äôt feel like a lot happened. Looking back, I just don‚Äôt care about the story or the characters.

title: What a waste of money!
text:
Well, if this is for Dummies, I need a book for STUPID. I found the starting level of Ms. King to be quite advanced. I mentioned to others and they told me to take a hands-on class.
I am NOT a dummie, however this book is written to a population that already has the language of photography etched in their minds. Also, from the start of this book there is all sorts of cross-referencing to future chapters which only confuses a reader more. The author attempts to explain something and says she will cover it in the future ....
No - I would not recommend this book.

title: A nauseating display of ego w pictures of Boudain, not food.
text: I love my cookbooks &mread them like a novel. This was the worst. Bourdins ego couldn't fit in my whole house, the White House, the entire continent. U nine what makes u think we WANT pictures of your chubby handed daughter included in this book? I'm surprised this idiot has a fan base. Pictures of food? NO Anthony's feet covered in four, Anthony's mouth streatched as large as a boa devouring an elephant chewing down on a disgusting sandwich, Anthony's cabinets, Anthony's pantry, Antony's refrigerator. Praise the lord he didn't subject us to Anthony's private parts! Totally disgusting & a complete waste of money! There may be good recipes' I don't know. No real food photos & the repeated pictures of Anthony made me want to burn my eyes out. Come on folks, the reviews were rather "subdued" but really folks, tell it like It is! Unless you collect pictures of boudain, pass on this book. It's more than off putting it is nauseating, now I know why Guy hates the man. Forget this book.

title: For laughs only....
text: What medication were they on when they compiled this book?  I love their show, and have enjoyed some of their other books, but this one is over the top silly.  If you're looking for "What to Wear to Clown School", this is the book!  Swarms of butterflies swirling over your head for a wedding?  You must be kidding.  If you're curious, I'd hit the local library, there's a reason these books are selling for a penny here.  I never give bad reviews and I adore these two women, but there is little of practical value for most women in this book.

title: Not For Me
text: I'm sorry, I feel stupid, because everyone on the end pages went on and on about the amazing writing and how good a book this is, but I just absolutely did not get it and would not recommend it.  Too long, too dark, and I think probably trying to do too much.  I didn't like any of the characters, I didn't like the story, I didn't like the plot, I didn't like much of anything except the idea of what I think he was trying to do and I hope he did and apparently he did for many people, but not for me.

title: Wow this is pretty bad
text: I really try not to leave negative reviews when I can't think of anything nice to say, but this book is really bad when held in comparison to the other books by Janet Evanovich. My main problem with this book, is that there is no fire between the characters at all. In a book like this, I feel there should be tension between the characters, and these ones are just flat and lifeless. Unfortunately, that wasn't the only problem. The authors had issues keeping their characters straight and telling a consistent story that made sense. I really like this author, but I really don't recommend this book at all. I made it through to the end, but barely and afterword I wondered why I had bothered. There just isn't much to redeem this book.

title: What a disappointment
text: I have read this series from the beginning. The last two books have been very disappointing. Ms. Stabenow seems to have developed a liking for the F word and GD. I'm not prude but the repetitious use of both of those things seemed really unnecessary. As others have mentioned, the author appears to be lacking enthusiasm. The previous book was a bit better but I'm struggling to get through this one. I don't think I'll buy any more books in the series if she writes more.

title: Dreck!
text: This was bad so utterly failed predictable. A character influenced by the whatever it is evil thing, grabs some chains and drives off. I guessed exactly what he was going to do down to finding his victim alive. Later a wimpy cop is at the morgue with his the chief. . . I said, they're going to leave him alone, lights will go out, evil thingy will put in an appearance. Deleted it from my Kindle after that, I even guessed who the evil would appear to the officer as. Terrible, it's generic horror at its worst.

title: Where's the Green?
text:
What a boring book. I was expecting to have some really great ideas to help have a low budget yet still appealing Christmas. Instead I got what seemed to me to be a half hearted attempt to make a so-called environmentally better Christmas by doing things that made Christmas feel destitute, colorless, and barren.

The overall appeal of the crafts was unimaginative, unappealing, and quite honestly, if it came to me having absolutely nothing and it was my only option to celebrate Christmas, I might do one or two, but for the most part, I would take out crayon remnant and color pretty pictures to hang around instead.

The recipes were also very ho hum, and I was very disappointed in this book. Just because you are having a low budget, low wasteful Christmas does not mean that it has to look like destitution. I really wanted to love this book, but it completely turned me off.

title: Can't recommend it
text: This is one of those women's fiction books that is shallow and underwhelming.  Claudia Silver, the entirely unlikable protagonist, is trying to figure out her life.  She doesn't get along with her family, especially mom, she's in all sorts of dysfunctional relationships, and she gets fired from her job.  This sounds like fairly classic women's novel plot. What makes other novels in the genre better than this one, is that they generally are written with a keen sense of humor or a protagonist with some redeeming qualities.  These things are absent in Claudia Silver.  In all honesty, pick a different book, I can find little to recommend in this one.

title: Disappointing at best
text: Buyer beware. I guess I thought at $15 this would be a regular size book. Of course, shame on me for not looking at the dimensions. This is a small almost pocket sized book with limited information in it pages are small with large type most with black and white pics). I never would have purchased this had I paid attention to the specifications. I would return it, but I used it in my 4 for 3 package and if I returned it, I would lose out. Disappointing, terrible purchase.

title: If you can make it through the first five pages without being bored to tears,  this book might be fore you
text:
BOOOOOORIIINGGGGG

I knew this book was going to suck when I ended up skipping the first five pages because they were some dull account of a sailing trip.

The book is full of useless details. This is the kind of book where you only need to read the first sentence of the paragraph and you'll have missed nothing. I read to page 40, skimmed to page 75 and then quit. I just can't do it. Also...I can not stand the narration style of the book....

Emily sits down at the table and opens up her laptop. She rolls her eyes and thinks about the hour she just wasted on this book. She muses, "it is massively annoying to read a book written in third person present tense. She throws the book across the room and ends her review, glad it's just a library book and she didn't have to waste money on it.

title: Neither beautiful nor mysterious - DULL, unfortunately
text:
I really liked "The Historian" and approached this book with enthusiasm, to be deeply disappointed. The story is lackluster and essentially pointless, and worst of all the 3 supposedly different voices that tell what passes for a story are completey indistinguishable. It's a trivial, insignificant project best suited as a stand-in for Ambien (unless, of course, you're a painter, in which case PERHAPS the endless navel-gazing about painterly suffering might possibly be of interest to you).
If you HAVE to read it, borrow it from the library, don't waste money buying the thing. It's just not worth it.

title: This is ONLY a journal.
text: Other than a couple of diagrams and simple charts on the first few pages, this is ONLY a journal. Sure, it's broken down into sections of "put your ingredients here, and detail how to prepare it here, etc, etc."  But if you're looking for creative suggestions of ingredients to pair or techniques to use in developing recipes, this is a hard pass.  If you're looking for a nice journal for developing and centralizing your recipes, this COULD have been the one...except that the binding doesn't allow the book to be flat, so good luck actually writing in it. It's terribly expensive for what it is.

title: Overly Analytical and Anything but Holistic
text: Ugh. Verbose. I read it cover to cover because I try to read everything that's published on tarot. Some people love it. I learned nothing from it. An obsessive compulsive study of RWS. It reminded me of reading a student's detailed notes while they were learning to read RWS and they decided to publish it. Nothing for anyone interested in TdM, and really nothing new for the RWS camp either that can't be found elsewhere and more concisely. Obsessively analytical and anything but holistic.

title: A Rip-Off!
text:
Most of the 54 page book is devoted to pictures of bread pans!

There are only TEN recipes. At $9.95 + tax, that amounts to about $1.00 a recipe!

Most no-knead bread recipes can be made with regular flour. Not this one, it ‚Äúrequires‚Äù bread flour.

This is self-published. It should be obvious why!

If it wasn‚Äôt so much trouble, I would return it.

You can find recipes for making no-knead bread, in bread pans, on the internet.

If you like pictures of bread pans, you will like it. If you do not, you will not.

I definitely, do not recommend!

title: Unreadable and unreliable
text: If you‚Äôre just going to hang this on the wall, there are probably better looking nautical charts that one could use. As far as actually reading it? The print is almost microscopic. Too small even with reading glasses on. Definitely not worth the price charged. Also, these are not all navigable rivers. If you look at this map, you would think that you can get to the Gulf from Lake Lanier north of Atlanta. That is not true. I wonder how many other rivers depicted on here are not navigable. One of the main reasons I got this was because it showed so many side trips from the great loop. But they are no good if I can‚Äôt actually rely on them to be usable. Yeah, as soon as you start researching you figure out that it‚Äôs not going to work, but I bought this map for basic preplanning and to get ideas.

title: Forget about it.
text: I find that Frost's earliest works contain some fanciful imagery, but there is a long period of his life in which he fought with depression-- as did his mother, sister, and wife. The bulk of this collection is from Frost's earlier years and is somewhat tiresome to read. There is no cadence and no rhyme to it, and it is a commentary on the darkness that he was fighting at that time in his life. If you are trying to "know" the man, buy it. If you want "Stopping by the Woods on A Snowy Evening" forget it.

title: Not what I was expecting
text: I purchased this because I was in the midst of preparing a college paper on Twain's use of religion and superstition in The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, but it not only was not what I expected, it ended up being of no use. I gained no insight into what Twain might have thought or felt at the time of writing Huck Finn because these were works from later in his life -- from a darker, more depressed state of mind. I could not even find enjoyment in reading it outside of the need created by the paper I was writing; this was not the Twain with whom I was familiar. A darker, more hopeless author conceived these pieces, and I found his state of mind entirely depressing.

title: Not something I would my child read
text: First off I read this book when I was In elamentary school. The reason Julie runs away is because dumb Daniel tries to force her to have sex with him at age 13. Not a subject I want a nine year old to deal with. Second she makes friends with wolves. Wild wolves are dangouous! They don't recomend you even keep a half wolf dog in your house because that predator instinct can kick in and they can kill you, but theese wolves don't see her as a snack they act more like a domestic dog pack. I'm sorry but I don't want my kids thinking wolves are safe. keep a respectfull distance please. I don't rember why my teacher made me read it so the point isn't memorable at all.

title: Do not buy!
text:
Very very disappointed.
Although there was only one review I took a chance on this product.
The pages showed promise when viewed online. I liked the aged look of them. I liked the artwork. I liked the fact that it was supposed to be an entire replica of the Charmed Book of Shadows. However the "aged" page doesn't even cover the entire page. Even the "blank" page doesn't cover the entire page. Had it been what it was supposed to be it would have been worth every penny of $55. This was bought as a gift for my daughter for her birthday so I will still gift it. However it's only because of her love for the series that I don't return it. Unfortunately I am not excited about giving it to her anymore.
Update: I've decided to return it. It's just not worth $55.

title: Poor scholarship and pure speculation
text:
I cannot recommend this book, on the basis of the first chapter regarding griffins. I frankly think that Chapter 1 is intentionally deceptive, because of how much misleading information the author presented. The author:

- Omitted any mention of griffin iconography in Southwest Asia - i.e., the several THOUSAND years of griffins in Mesopotamia and the Iranian plateau.
- Failed to cite any Chinese or other East Asian sources regarding Protoceratops at gold mines (and I am pretty sure there are none).
- Failed to highlight the numerous anatomical discrepancies between ceratopsians and griffins (feet do not match, heads do not match, limbs do not match).
- Most egregiously, produced a misleading map on page 28. The author left off a scale and any specific sites, masking that the area is nearly 1 million square miles. Gold mines and Cretaceous dinosaur finds are nowhere near each other in Central Asia, but by making a bad map the author is able to mislead readers.

This is shoddy and misleading scholarship, and I cannot recommend it.

title: It can only be classified as a color by number IF you can see the numbers right?
text: you've got to be kidding me.... how is this a color by number?  You can't even see the numbers - I even broke out the magnifying glass just trying to see if I could figure out what the colors were before deciding that instead of reducing my stress level it's elevating it.  I admit I read other people's reviews and thought to myself 'how bad could it really be?' and since nobody uploading any pictures to give me a guideline of how hard they really are to see I went ahead and bought it... anyway, just to help out anyone else who might be thinking about buying this color by number book I took some CLOSE UP pictures of small sections of the design so that you'll have a better understanding of what the issue is... now if you can see them clearly then good luck... and for anyone who I've saved from a lot of frustration... you're welcome!

title: Not really "reusable" stickers as the cover claims
text:
The cover says these are reusable stickers.... they are not! The stickers are less sticky, so yes, you can pull them up and lay them back down once or twice (at best). Total rip off and way overpriced for only "75 stickers".

The Melissa and Doug Reusable Vinyl sticker book is a far better value for the same price. They have several themes to choose from

If your looking for just stickers, I recommend the Thomas Sticker Express (Super Stickerific) which has 700+ stickers which are high quality. I'm not 100% sure if Golden Books makes another 700+ sticker book like this one in other themes, but I sure hope so because this Thomas book is awesome. It's expensive, but worth the extra cost.

http://www.amazon.com/Melissa-Doug-Habitats-Reusable-Sticker/dp/B004PBN9BC/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1358907950&sr=8-1&keywords=melissa+and+doug+reusable+sticker+pad

and

http://www.amazon.com/THOMAS-STICKER-EXPRESS-Friends-Stickerific/dp/0375841261/ref=sr_1_6?ie=UTF8&qid=1358906854&sr=8-6&keywords=thomas+the+train+coloring+book

title: Blood and Thunder by Hampton Sides
text:
Reading the cover, one would think that it was about Kit Carson, and his role in the development of the west. You would be, like me, terribly wrong.
This disappointing masters thesis is about everything other than Kit Carson and the opening of the west. It's about Pres. Polks sly Manifest Destiny ruse, throwing Native Americans off their land, bullshitting Mexico into believing that they have ben beaten in the war, and unbelieveable amounts of ink and paper regarding some Navaho Chief, and his misadventures in the desert of the southwest.
The author's failed attempt to awe his readers by using difficult language and big, but utterly useless words, shows him to be the sophmoric wannabe as opposed to someone who is supposed to have the ability to create cogent sentences.
All in all, Sides missed the boat on this one. Try again, and try to stick to the outline.
A waste of ink, paper, and money when so many other volumes exist that really address Sides missed points.

title: dreadfully boring retelling
text: I've reviewed several Classic Starts having read at least a half dozen with my kindergarten age boys.  I have to write this is a very poor retelling.  I really enjoyed a few of the Classic Starts but this one is not the only Classic Start that is woefully done.  Never a substitute for the real thing, I still thought Pinocchio, Tom Sawyer and Call of the Wild were decently retold.  Moby Dick, The Jungle Book and Treasure Island were bearable.  But 20,000 Leagues was so boring.  This is not a commentary or opinion on the Jules Verne original -- a great story.  It's just this retelling of it is so mechanically narrated with none of the character's internal muse.  Another one that is almost unbearable is Swiss Family Robinson.  I suppose the original texts just don't lend themselves to simplification.

title: This is a small toddler board book, not for school age kids.
text: [[VIDEOID:cb170ff4ff7eb97818ce846c9b275c96]] This is a baby board book, not a board book as listed. Read all the reviews before you buy this for your school aged child. Apparently it only comes in a small board book format, even though it‚Äôs listed as a hardcover. The photos I took compares it with a regular sized hardcover. It‚Äôs misleading. I bought 2 of these before realizing that. Then I read the reviews and did some research....oops. Though this is great for babies and toddlers to chew on, a school age child might not feel like a big kid if they receive it. As a school teacher, I know it‚Äôs too ‚Äúlittle kid‚Äù for my students.

title: Boring!
text:
Geez! What's all the hype about?? Absolutely nothing happened! This is like soft-core-faux-porn for housewives that had a herd of babies in their 20's instead of exploring and discovering who their sexual selves are (in a healthy and safe way of course!!) I forced myself to finish just so that I could give it an honest review and in the hopes of getting to some "meat" (no pun intended) and finding that I was compelled to read the next in the series...... But nope! That definitely did not happen!
Additionally, I am forgiving of first-time published authors, however, there was so much ramble, so much unnecessary detail (and none at all where it counts) and repetition of adjectives often on the same page that I'd be hard pressed to even consider reading this author in the future.

title: In Order To Like a Book, One Needs to Like the Characters
text: Immediately it became apparent that the lead character is a lazy, snob with barely any ambition and takes wine and brioche into the mountains while camping. Seriously? I couldn't stand the lead character from the first page. The writing is so boring and the character so obnoxious that I could only get to the part where the main character meets an old man that asks if he is an earthling and has seen the flying saucer. Okay, I give up, life is too short to read something that is ridiculous and a waste of one's time. Those titles of the author I put on my wish list? They've been deleted.

title: Do not recommend
text:
I have probably purchased hundreds of books from Amazon, and only returned one. This book will be the second to be returned.

The title implies simple cooking with ‚Äú75 Modern Recipes‚Ä¶‚Äù That is not the case. Most people use a pressure cooker to save time, and don‚Äôt have the time, to find the fancy ingredients, that are called for in this book.

When herbs are called for, they are usually fresh. We all have access to fresh herbs. Sure, we can substitute dried, but the ingredients list should give the amounts.

Oxtails with fennel, Osso Buco, Duck Confit, Mussels with Garlic + Lager, Spanish Garlicky Squid + Chorizo, are some of the recipes.

Reality did occasionally set-in with recipes for cooking rice, Macaroni + Cheese, Polenta, French Onion Soup, and Beef Barley Vegetable Soup.

I have worked in a hotel kitchen, and I know something about food. If I want to do fancy cooking, this book wouldn‚Äôt be the one I use.

The author works for the New York Times, maybe it is time to bring back Mark Bittman.

I‚Äôm still looking for a book that addresses my Instant Pot.

title: Did not hold my attention
text:
Books reviews are tough as the enjoyment of a book is so subjective. That being said, I did not care for South With The Sun. I'm not sure if this was a published book from a major book publisher that had editorial review, or it was "self-published". In any event, it could have used much re-writing and a lot more editorial review as it is a rather amateur endeavor. The story primariy concerns the author attempting to swim in the oceans that Amundsen visited during his explorations.

There was very little about Amundsen, about his expeditions, his challenges, his successes and failures. It was mostly about swimming in cold water to somehow bring self-aggrandizement to the author.

I'd pass on this book.

title: Be Aware Of The Size Before Buying
text: I know it's my fault but the size of this coloring book should not be hidden down in the 'product dimensions' section of the Product Details are, eight lines down. So utterly disappointed and disgusted getting a 5" x 8" coloring book when every other coloring book I've bought have been full size 8.5" x 11" coloring books. These pictures are small, cramped and hard to color. The size should have been openly disclosed in the main product information. I blame myself but also the publisher. Even worse? This and the other two surprisingly small coloring books were chosen from the back of [[ASIN:1574219952 Good Vibes Coloring Book (Coloring Is Fun)]] which is a full size coloring book but even worse a good third of the content of  this 'Color Cool' book are IN the Good Vibes coloring book. We bought them full size and now we have them in miniature. What a waste of money. We get to color the same pictures twice, joy. I'll be far more careful in picking products from this or any other product. This was another terribly disappointing experience.

title: Bored to Tears From the Start...
text: I tried to read this book on multiple occasions.  I never made it past the first dozen or so pages. I was bored to tears.  That is something i never thought I'd say about a Paul Theroux book. I've read a number of his books and loved/very much liked each.  Not Under the Wave at Waimea.  I felt no connection to Joe Sharkey, the main character of the book. I didn't want to know more about him, I didnt' want to hear his story.  I don't  know...perhaps the book gets better as it moves along but I didn't have a desire to find out.  I donated my copy to the local Goodwill.  I hope the person who buys it has better luck with it and enjoys it.

title: Worst of many Gould biographies
text:
Ostwald obviously was upset that Gould turned away from him. This biography is nothing but a shrinks' analysis after being cast aside and feeling hurt. Compared to other biographies, you can tell that after Ostwald was dumped he has no solid facts about Gould. And much of what he writes is contradicted by other biographers who were working with Gould's close friends, letters, and other documents.
This book is a sham, written by a self-absorbed psychiatrist who wanted to make a buck off of his one-time (and short) association with someone famous. Avoid.
If you want an accurate, reliable, well-researched, and very FAIR account of Glenn Gould's life, consider the one written by Kevin Bazzana: "Wondrous Strange: The Life and Art of Glenn Gould."

title: Super, super thin card stock.
text:
Holy smokes. I own almost 100 decks, Mass Market and Indie alike. I have to say, this is the thinnest, most fragile card stock I‚Äôve ever seen used on a deck. Think of the card stock you buy at Office Depot to use in your printer, then divide that width in half. That‚Äôs how thin it is. The cover of the companion book is actually twice as thick as the cards themselves.

The weird thing... I‚Äôm usually the last person to get worked up about crappy card stock. It‚Äôs usually not that important to me. But, this is just too silly. It‚Äôs basically paper! It‚Äôs hard to believe the artist signed off on this as a prototype. It‚Äôs terrible. And cheap. And makes the deck impossible to shuffle and therefor unsatisfying to use. I‚Äôm super disappointed. I‚Äôll never buy from this publisher again.

title: Not up the the standards of the previous two books.
text: I LOVED the previous two books in this series.  They were beautiful designed and published and great fun to complete. The third book is a disappointment.  The book is half the size of the previous books at the same price.  The topic could have been explored more.  There are fruits to paint!  Papaya, coconut, pineapple,  and figs in very simplistic shapes.  They could have at least been presented hanging on their plants or with leaves!  Where is the giraffe? I preordered this book as soon as it appeared on Amazon and was waiting with great anticipation for it to arrive.  I was surprised at the decrease in quality.  I think that Dana Fox is such a talented artist and her first too books wonderful. I had hoped for more.  For some reason, this book does not meet the standards previously presented.

title: Print quality is below awful, a photocopy of a photocopy
text:
Sadly, an awful 2022 copy with unreadable pictures and faded blurry text on many pages. Looks like a bad photocopy of a photocopy, and made on ‚Äònewspaper‚Äô quality pages. Made by publishing place quoted quite strangely - see the last photo. I placed the order on Jul 17, and received Jul 25th, 2022 while it was just printer on Jul12th according to the last page of it.

Returning. I will look for a used original from a reputable publisher, as the content appear quite interesting just this copy is not really readable.

title: Simply Stunning...
text: Kudos to Dark Horse for keeping this train wreck on track.  I've commented on the other recent installments about the sad direction this series has taken and it just seems to get worse and worse.  Poor story, poor artwork...sigh. I love Conan and really loved the earlier volumes, but now I'm just hoping they pull the rip cord on this one and maybe someone else will take the reigns.  If you're looking for good reads and good artwork check the early ones and leave these newer ones on a shelf where they belong.

title: Instructional? Not Exactly
text:
I got this book as a reference for finding new things to add to my journaling, and step-by-step guides to producing those.

Spoiler alert: only a few items have a step-by-step institutions. Mostly, what you see are fully drawn items appearing in collections. Want to draw a Baobab tree? Well here‚Äôs a completed one so you know what yours should resemble. Want to draw a mini Schnauzer to remind you your dog has a vet appointment? Well, here‚Äôs a completed sample of a mini schnauzer, but step-by-step instructions for drawing a Shiba inu. Seriously. Why is this being sold as an instruction manual and not simply a gallery of cute and colorful doodles?
This ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù guide is being revised for a return as we speak

title: Not well written
text:
I got this for my mother. I assumed as she feels this way, she would enjoy reading the book. She did not. She said it was very poorly written and was very hard to follow. Yes, she is 84 but her mind is sharp and she knows what she likes. If she did not like this, it must not have been well written at all. She subscribes to what the authors were trying to convey....she just said it was written as though it was a book to make money, not make America understand what is happening.

I asked her how many stars to give it and she said none. I can't do that so it gets 1.

title: inaccurate description, should get 0 stars
text:
DON'T BUY. The heading says the calendar is 8 1/2 x 11" whereas the fine print gives the real size of 8 1/2 x 8 1/2". It also describes it as Large which it clearly is not. I've never seen a wall calendar this small.
On top of this, when a calendar has a title on the front, such as "Dogs" you expect to see a different photo of a dog on each page, not one dog and the rest all different kinds of animals. That's what this calendar has. One photo of Hampton Court Palace and the rest pictures of other places. One page has a picture of palm trees, one page has a pagoda and a barge. And even more ridiculous, none of the pictures are labeled so you have no idea where it is or what it is a picture of... Got as a gift, going in the trash.

title: May your marinara never cling to your pasta!
text:
I have been waiting on this for weeks. This was my favorite show as a kid and I even dressed up like Sophia for Halloween one year. I also have several kits like this from the same designer. Every other kit contains a separate book, yarn, notions, and a hook within a large box. This is what I was expecting.

I am so disappointed that I am literally crying. First off, the yarn is crap, but that's not a huge deal because I bought this mainly for the book. However, the stupid box is attached to the book! It's not stuck to the back with annoying glue boogers ; it's smack dab in the middle of this big hardback book. It's the stupidest thing I have ever seen. To make matters worse, the box is damaged and opened. The yarn is incomplete and this book will be garbage soon because there is an empty flimsy box in the middle. I hate this and I want a refund!

title: I don't get the point of this book
text: I had to read this in seventh grade as part of our growing up unit. I didn't get the point of the book or why the teacher made me read this book when other kids were reading other books. any how The story was about a fat boy with no self confadance. Basically he didn't get any untill he started to lose weight. His best friend got a nose job and got confidance. so I guess the moral of the story is looks are important. There was a scene in the book that hinted at masturbation that went right over my head at the time, but as an adult I find not aceptable for the age group that is actually reading it. Better suited to kids about three years older.

title: A truly dreadful penny dreadful
text:
A penny dreadful, with the emphasis on dreadful. Published in 1910. Here's an excerpt:
"It was easier said than done. The chattering bunch of Chinks crowding around offered no help.

"I don't see how in thunder we are going to get the boy up without a ladder," muttered Old King Brady.

"And where will we find one?" echoed Harry.

"That's the point. But here comes a policeman. Perhaps he can suggest‚Äî‚Äî"

Thus far in his speech Old King Brady got when there came another call for help.

He could not exactly make out the words, but it was certainly, also, a cry of fear.

"Let go! Don't you touch me!" they heard now.

The cry came from the hole.

Then all was still below, although above the Chinamen chattered louder than ever.

"By Jove! the Chinks are going for the boy," cried Harry. "He has fallen into one of the secret dens of Pell street, sure!"

It looked like it.

The policeman came."

I think that suffices for a full review.

title: Don't feed into the hype and waste your money
text: I know people are going crazy over this book but don't waste your money there are plenty of blogs and articles on the internet. Nothing in this book is any different than what anybody says. There is no magic information that you will find. In my opinion I don't really think that this is a new concept for I have been doing most of the stuff for most of my life anyway. Buy this book if you just want to learn how to fold clothes because that's all I got out of it. If you must read this book go to the library for free.

title: WARNING!
text: WARNING.  The titled author reports this book as a little bit disjointed.  One reviewer points out that the foreword author that stated he gave up fly fishing shortly after reading this book.  That reviewer reports that had he read this book before taking up fly fishing, he would not have taken up fly fishing.  Another reviewer reports that he got tired of reading descriptions of clouds.  I read this book and found it incoherent.  I am a book lover, and once undertaken, I invariably read a book to the end.  So, I plowed on, much to my chagrin.  I was puzzled.  What was this guy trying to say?  Well, nothing.  I did some research on Harry Middleton.  Much to my shock and surprise, I found that he was reported to be bi-polar, maniacally depressed.  When he lost his job as an editor and finished this book, he took his own life.  His publisher went on because Harry left a wife and kids.  What else do you have to know.  If you want to make a contribution to Harry's kids' education, send it to his publisher with instructions.  In any case, go read John Gierach.  Nother he write is a waste of time.  Walwyn M. Trezise, Dubois, Wyoming

title: Kindle delay = lost customer
text:
I appreciate the author taking time to post up his request for the reviews of his book to stop being about the delay, but as a book lover and also as a enthusiastic reader who has purchased a device strictly to read books, I feel his publisher is being extremely unfair to those of us who have gone above and beyond in order to enjoy our books.

A delayed release policy does nothing to fight piracy, nor does it increase hardback sales. In fact, it has cost this publisher a customer due to being "punished" for spending 300$ on a fancy way to read a book.

Until the industry recognizes that punishing the ebook readers is a very dumb thing to do, I will not be purchasing any books from them.

title: Princess the Cat is an unpleasant feline.
text:
After the third chapter, I asked my daughter if I could stop reading this book. She agreed. We found it a bit brutal in the first 3 chapters, and the cat was extremely unlikable. I was hoping for something funny and snarky, like the My Weirder School series, but this didn't get there for me by chapter 3. The book itself is poorly designed I feel. It is heavy, hard to read while in bed because of its shape and size, and my daughter and I usually read with the lights low, but this is printed so tiny that is not possible.
So, yes, I only read through to chapter 3, but how much time are you supposed to give to something you find unpleasant?
My daughter is 9, and we like things like Mouse Scouts, My Weirder School, Harry Potter, Nancy Drew, Lemony Snicket.

title: Give this one a pass
text: This book was a bit too saccharine for my tastes.  This is the sort of book where a few pages in you know that everything is going to turn out just fine.
